file_content.text: I can feel your presence... Vitiate.
I had foreseen your arrival, but I didn't believe it.
Hello, my Wrath. I foresaw your arrival, but I didn't quite believe it.
My little insect, no doubt here to drone and flutter once more.
I thought, after bearing witness to my rebirth on the Yavin moon, why? Why would you stand in the face of certain death?
And then I realized: you're a simple one. Not terribly bright. But that's fine--I'm rather pleased you're here.
I promised on the Yavin moon that I would devour you last, and yet here you are. So impatient.
When you've lived as long as I have, patience comes far more easily--but that's neither here nor there. I must say, I'm glad you're here.
Dromund Kaas, the Yavin moon... It must not be clear to you yet. There is nothing you can do to stop me.
You'll bear witness to a world's end if you survive long enough.
That's all right, though. Seeing you, it's like visiting with a forgotten friend. I'm oddly pleased you're here.
You're far from stupid, I know that much. Overly ambitious, perhaps. Well, regardless, I do hope you find your time on Ziost enlightening.
